I'm biased, but I think this podcast episode turned out pretty well.

30+ years of lessons learned condensed into a well-edited (albeit fast) conversation.

As an introvert, I pass on most podcast invites (would rather be coding).

But,this time, I made an exception.

Here's where I reveal many of the secrets I've learned over 30 years. I hope you enjoy it and find it useful. Thanks. @harrystebbings!

@thesamparr @bhalligan Candidly, no.

Remember, it took us 8 years to go from zero to IPO (and ~$1 billion in market cap).

We thought that was amazing.

Then, we went from $1B to $15B in the following 8 years. 

Now, we have even bigger aspirations for the NEXT 8 years.

Lots of exciting work to do.

HubSpot turns 2^4  today.  @bhalligan and I founded the company on June 9, 2006.

We had big dreams.
We had high hopes.
We had no idea what it would become.

My thanks to all HubSpotters, alumni and most of all our customers and partners.

We grew better together. https://t.co/PxfvKcnbqd

UX Tip: When allowing users to enter an authorization code, assume people will copy/paste from text or email.

If like me, they'll often mistakenly copy the code with an extra space in the beginning.

Don't chop off what's pasted in. Remove extra spaces. Be forgiving.

Babe Ruth was known for his homerun records.

He also often had the most strikeouts in the season.

But, people don't remember the strikeouts, they remember the homeruns.

Lesson: Take your swings.
@Serpephone Sorry for the issues. Will look into it.
This is so well done.
Amazing. I would not have believed it had I not experienced it myself.

It's better to treat ideas as relative, not absolute.

Don't say: That's a bad idea. It will not work.

That closes the door.

Instead, try: Here's an iteration on that idea. It may be more likely to work.

That opens new doors.

Noticed a dark UX pattern in TikTok today.

When you press Command+L (which I use thousands of times a day, to move the cursor to the location bar), on TikTok, it shows you a login modal. The override Command+L!

Not cool, TikTok, not cool.  #darkpattern https://t.co/Hhrgtgue45

For years, I've been talking about the need for conversational UI. So we, as humans, don't have to translate our intent into a series of clicks, drags and touches. We can express it naturally.

I'm glad somebody's working on it now.

@JeffBezos Also, narratives/memos don't have a bad day -- but presenters do.

Too many people over-index on the presenter/presentation and under-index on the ideas.

@JeffBezos I think twitter might still be accepting other offers.

For a low, low price, you can have an edit button!

My personal thanks to @JeffBezos for promoting the idea of using narratives over slide decks.

For introverts like me, it works much better. Slides have to be presented, narratives speak on your behalf.
